headline: Vegetable Pizza
description: Quick, tasty vegetable pizza recipe that is as versatile as it is easy. Customize with favorite veggies and you'll be set with a meal everyone loves.

video.description: This tasty party pizza is like creamy veggie dip in pizza form!
video.name: Vegetable Pizza I

name: Vegetable Pizza
recipeIngredient: 1 (1 ounce) package dry Ranch-style dressing mix

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Roll out crescent roll dough onto a 9x13-inch baking sheet, and pinch together edges to form the pizza crust.
Bake crust in the preheated oven for 12 minutes. Once finished cooking, remove crust from the oven and let cool for about 15 minutes without removing it from the baking sheet.
Combine cream cheese, mayonnaise, and dry Ranch dressing mix in a small mixing bowl. Spread the mixture over the cooled crust.
Arrange broccoli, tomatoes, bell pepper, cauliflower, shredded carrots, and Cheddar cheese over the cream cheese layer.
Chill for 1 hour, slice, and serve.

review.reviewBody: Have used this recipe with all types of customizing for 20+ years. Here's a few hints. Pillsbury has the dough sheets now - no trying to squeeze the perforations together - yay! I use a spoonful or so of Miracle Whip and go light on the Ranch dressing. Rather than adding each topping separately, I chop everything fine, stir it all up in a big bowl, along with the shredded cheddar. I use broccoli, celery (chopped superfine), cauliflower, carrots, red, yellow and green peppers, sweet onion (family only - you might not want onion breath at your party!) and fine shredded cheese. If you use tomatoes, use roma and drain the seeds and juice as much as possible; same with cucumbers : juicy items like tomatoes will make your crust soggy, and may 'bleed' into your cream cheese. Once I top the crust with the cream cheese mixture, I cut into two inch squares and put them on the baking sheet. Then, sprinkle the toppings liberally , pushing them deep into the cream cheese. This will keep them from being quite so messy to serve and eat. Almost everyone loves this dish - but it can be tricky to eat, so the smaller 'slices' make them easier to handle.
Excellent. I didn't have carrots but I used colored peppers
It was good I enjoyed it chilled but the cream cheese mixture was salty. Will make it again but will cut down mayonnaise

I have been making a version of this for years that I would give 5 stars over this one: Leave out the ranch, and add some garlic and onion powder instead. Do not top with cheddar cheese and sprinkle Mrs's Dash instead.
This was the go-to bridal / baby shower appetizer of the early ‘90s... spot on. Don’t change a thing except maybe add green onion.
I love this vegetable pizza recipe. I love it with the mayonnaise and the hidden Valley Ranch dressing. Makes it so much better. The kids love it and request it all the time.
vegetables aren't my thing but my family loves them so when I made this and enjoyed it!
This turned out good. I did add fresh dill to the cream cheese mixture. You really can play with this to make it your own It was a hit at the super bowl party. I would make again for bunko.
Always have loved this. This recipe was perfect.
Nice to bring to potlucks because it’s convenient. Cut the crust with a pizza cutter before you put anything on it, makes it MUCH easier.
Wayyyyy too much filling.
I made this for a picnic and it was gone in no time! The only adjustment I made was using 2/3 of a packet of ranch seasoning with dill in it to make the dish less salty - which made a difference.
I love ranch but I don't care for it with the veggie pizza. It just doesn't have enough flavor to go with the crescent rolls. I prefer the recipe that has the dill.
The best veggie pizza recipe!!

I have had other versions of this and liked them, but unfortunately this one had way too much cream cheese and ranch for my tastes, I couldn't finish a piece. And looking at the nutritional info. it has 467 calories PER SERVING, and 38.8 grams of fat per serving. So, I would change it up a lot with using neufachtel and use less and only a sprinkle of ranch powder. And would not refrigerate it. But, as always, thanks for posting and giving us recipes to try!
my husband and I love this
Love this recipe! It is easy to follow and delicious! I made it for a group and everyone asked me for the recipe.
Love this recipe! It is easy to follow and delicious! I made it for a group and everyone asked me for the recipe.
Easy and a hit at the potluck I took them to.
I take this to potlucks and I’m always asked for the recipe.
Everyone loved it!
I would use half of the amount of ranch seasoning
This is always a crowd pleaser!!
I would not use two packages of cream cheese. It was WAY to much. Next time I will use one package of cream cheese.

I always love this recipe. I always like changing up the types of veggies though. I seem to usually have leftover cream cheese mixture but found out when I mixed that with leftover chopped vegetables that it is excellent on bagels!

This was a big hit! So yummy! 

I followed 90% of the recipe - my only changes were that I only added a little shredded cheese and I put it on top of the cream cheese mixture (under the veggies) so that it would stick and not fall off when eaten. 

I used red pepper instead of green, omitted the carrots and added green onions. I used purple cauliflower and it was sooo pretty!

Oh - I recommend gutting/seeding the tomatoes so that they don't get your pizza soggy. Also, I found that gently pushing the veggies down before cutting them made them stick to the bread so guests didn't lose their toppings. 

This was really great - I can't wait to try some more variations - thanks for the recipe! :)
I made this for our Fathers day cookout. I used sour cream instead of mayonnaise. It was great. Will make again, but I think I will follow the recipe and use mayo next time.
Very good and big hit at our party. I decreased the ranch dressing to half the pack. Less salty.

I make this fairly often, and it’s always a hit. I substituted 0% fat greek yogurt for half the mayonnaise, used the reduced fat crescent roll dough, and will probably sub yogurt for the whole amount of mayo next time I make it, just to make this a bit more healthy.
I accidentally bought Crescent crust instead of rolls. I didn't know they had such a thing! I think the crusts are larger than the rolls, so I made much more than I needed. Always good, though!
This is a classic, must-have dish. I love it as is
Too much mayo and too much spread. Reduce spread by almost half and cut mayo in half. Maybe use sour cream instead of mayo? Instead or ranch dressing maybe garlic and dill weed?
I have made this several times and it's been a hit at every party! I find broccoli, cauliflower and carrot is sufficient...less is more!

This was great but I have been making it for a long time. I use a packet of Lipton Vegetable secrets soup mix with the mayo, Colored peppers, shredded cheddar, broccoli and cauliflower. Always a hit!!!

This appetizer has been at nearly every baby shower, wedding shower and wedding that I've attended over the last 30 years. Great, classic recipe that almost everyone loves. If you care about appearance, like I do, make sure to dice/chop the veggies all the same size. They should be very small and uniform. Another tip, make sure to mash the crescent roll dough so that it is even. Some people make this and have "fluffy" crust or uneven crust. You want the crust to be rather flat and uniform.
On a hot day so very good family loved it
Amazingly good. I made this for a birthday party at work and it was a hit! Everyone kept asking me for the recipe. I used less mayo than required and it turned out amazing. 5 stars!

I love this recipe. I have made it several times. My family only likes broccoli, cauliflower, carrots, and green peppers, and shredded cheese. I add a pinch of dill, not too much, adds a kick of flavor. Personal tip: Cut the pizza after putting on spread, before adding vegetables and cheese. Keeps pizza looking pretty and easier.
I used 1 tub herb and garlic cream cheese, 1 tub plain cream cheese . Loved it! So nice and colourful and crunchy! Will be making this again and again!
Fast easy delicious. I did make a change for ease...I used a container of veggie cream cheese instead of doing the ranch mix....yum yum!!! Great for any get together

I made this in my or first or second year cooking class. I just fell in love with it. This was out of my years in that cooking class, this was my favorite recipe. I brought some home and my mom, dad and grandpa loved it!!! I made some last year and my Brother loved it even his 4 year old Daughter loved it. You don't get much young children that like veggies, this style of pizza really makes the veggies tolerable
This is so easy and so quick even the kids love it!
I just chopped up broccoli, cauliflower, Carrots and a little onion and it was Awesome!
I loved this recipe. I tried sour cream instead of mayo and liked it better that way. I also used 1 1/2 cans of crescent roll instead of 2 which made it a little less doughy. I will make it again
I dice the vegetables very small, and add pieces of deli ham on the top. Very delicious, won't last long at a potluck or dinner party.
I rolled out the crescent dough on a baking sheet and baked in a 375 oven for 12 minutes...the bottom was completely burnt and stuck had to throw it out. :(
It was great the way I made it with only 1/2 of the cream cheese mixture.
I love this! I will be making this quite often!
Every time I make this everyone loves it and ask for the recipe. I wouldn't change a thing
I make this for work and home parties. I used Miracle Whip instead of mayo. It gives it a little more flavor. I also use low fat cream cheese It is always a big hit.
Awesome! Even my veggie-hating son likes this one :)
This is the best veggie pizza I have ever had. I used the garlic butter crescent rolls and it made it even better. Everyone loved it!!

Great recipe. I used miracle whip vs. mayonnaise & crescent rolls that weren't perforated. I may add garlic and dill weed for extra flavor the next time. I recommend using sharp cheddar vs. mild cheddar. I mixed the miracle whip, cream cheese and hidden valley ranch dressing mix the night before and refrigerated it so the flavors could blend. Also 7 minutes was PLENTY of time to cook the roll (the recommended 12 minutes listed in the recipe yielded me burnt buns, lol). The dish was a hit & I'll be making it again soon!

This is my favorite veggie pizza recipe. I like the two packages of crescent rolls and cream cheese. I bake mine in a 10x15 jelly roll pan. I set out my cream cheese so it is room temperature and mix it with the mayo in my mixer, I add a teaspoon of dill. I sometimes change up the veggies on top. I have made this for family gatherings, graduation parties, and made 4 of them for my in-laws 70th Anniversary party. Everyone loves it!

This recipe was a hit! I was unable to fit two cans of crescent rolls in my 9x13 inch pan, so I halved the recipe. The first time I made this, it seemed terribly salty and the veggies kept falling off while my family was trying to eat it. The second time I made it, I mixed the mayonnaise, cream cheese and dressing mix together the night before and let the flavors blend in the refrigerator. The next day I baked the crust and assembled it. I also lightly pushed down on all the veggies and cheese before refrigerating the finished pizza to help everything "stick" to the crust. That did the trick because it held together well and tasted delicious! Even the kids, who are not veggie fans, loved this pizza!

I have used this recipe many times and its always a hit. I usually mix the grated cheddar in with the cream cheese mix, and use a food processor to chop the cauliflower finer, use broccoli cole slaw mix, diced green bell peppers. I press the vegies into the cream cheese when spreading them on the vegie bars. Be sure to refrigerate these once made for a couple of hours to set everything.
We have been making these for years. We call them Confetti's. Everywhere we have had them there has been raves. Mix up the colors of the veggies for each holiday.
Always a hit. I add a little sour cream to make it creamier. I also leave out the carrots and shredded cheese. Instead of tomatoes I do red bell peppers-still also include the green.

The Pros: A great variety of veggies. Loved that. First time trying crescent rolls, liked that as well.

The Cons: Only one, but I consider to be very important and the reason I gave it 2 stars instead of 4, the dry ranch mixture completely overpowered the flavor of the cream cheese.It made it impossible to eat.

I find it odd, because I don't see any mention of that in any other review, but I followed the recipie exactly as it is written. I didn't skimp on the veggies and I used two packages of cream cheese and 1oz package of dry ranch mix, and despite following the reciepie exactly as it is written, after about the second piece of pizza, I couldn't eat anymore. I normally like Ranch on my pizza's but next time, I may only use half the package or none at all. My advice would be to add the dry ranch sparingly and taste it as you add more, to make sure it doesn't become overbearing before spreading it over the bread.

Other than that, I would make this again. I am trying to find ways for my family to eat more veggies. I have a two year old son who hates veggies, but I chopped everything up in small fine pieces, and to my excitement, he ate most of the veggies. It was great! He loves pizza, so this was a great healthy substitute.
made this for a vegetarian. she loved it! I had it before, and it is an awesome recipe. I followed the recipe, and the pizza turned out great. thanks a bunch!

I dislike the sauce that's spread on the pizza. There's something about it that doesn't mesh well with my tastebuds. I did find some shortcuts for this dish that reduce the preparation time, and it also improves the flavor. 

Instead of cream cheese, dry ranch dip mix, and mayonnaise, purchase premade vegetable ranch dip and spread that over the crescent rolls. Instead of crescent rolls, which you have to spread out and try to cover the surface as well as stick together, you can purchase pizza dough (Pillsbury makes them and they're on the same shelves as the crescent rolls). This will make it a LOT easier to spread out, and it bakes evenly without lumps. 

Enjoy!

This pizza is requested at every potluck I attend! It is easy to make and stores nicely! No need to worry about it cooling down when sitting out like a traditional pizza. This is also a great way to sneak in veggies!

My Mom used to make this when I was younger and I still love it. It is my go to recipe for potlucks and get togethers. I use pizza crust and cut it first when cooled before topping. Then I use 1/2 the cream cheese, 1/2 the mayo and 1/2 the ranch packet. I top w/ shredded raw broccoli slaw (found in a bag in the produce aisle), shredded carrots, shredded cheddar cheese and any extra veggies on hand. NUM, never any extras!

This pizza can be done in so many ways , I tried it the way it stated the first time , then went on to make it again the way I enjoy it . Both are great , but adding salt and pepper , and feta cheese makes this so much better , and use romaine tomatoes . This makes a huge pizza ,and such a great party please for all the health nuts out there like me .
Add some cheddar cheese on top as well
This one is always a crowd pleaser

As my kids do not like big chunks of veggies, I limited the veggies to brocolli, cauliflower, green peppers and carrots. I then put them into the food processor until finely blended. It becomes a texture that you can sprinkle on top of the crust and "sauce". Perfect! I even took it to work and one lady said it was so good...she couldn't believe it had cauliflower in it becuase she claimed to hate it. Very easy way to get your kids to eat these veggies if normally they won't!
The cream cheese part was way too salty and not thick enough.

This is very yummy. Because they request it, I make it for my daughters cheer team, for competition, every Saturday for 8 weeks in the winter time. As a matter of fact, I'm making it right this minute :)
I've made this many times and it's always a hit! I use Philadelphia Garden Vegetable cream cheese in the tub. It's a time saver and tastes great.
This is my go-to recipe for family get-togethers. I use a broccoli slaw mix and other veggies. I have also added black olives. Very versatile.
Loved it! I used a fiesta ranch dip and it was great!

Pretty good, but overall I think that the vegetable pizzas always call for too much of the cream cheese spread and it overshadows the flavor of the vegetables instead of complementing them. Put less spread on and this will taste just right.

I made this pizza for my family who loved it. I had trouble with the amount of dough which was too much for a 9 x 13 pan so I decided to make two smaller ones in two sheet pans. I divided the amounts in half and it worked perfectly. In fact the kids loved it because each got there own individual pizza!

I absolutely adore this recipe! I half this recipe and make it up on the weekend and will take it for lunch during the week. It is so easy and yummy! Also great on weight watchers. I do half this recipe, in 6 servings, and it is only 3pts each (using fat free everything of course) Love it!
A must use appetizer for any occasion! Everyone loves this recipe!

This is a go to for me at office parties when everyone else signs up to bring in the desserts. It usually goes pretty fast, and it's easier to eat vegetables this way then trying to spoon some ranch on your paper plate and grabing some carrot sticks. It's also probably less healthy, but who are you trying to kid, no one eats eathing at those things! That being said, I use reduced fat crescent rolls, fat free mayo, and fat free cream cheese when I make these to soften the blow on the calorie front. I haven't had any complaints from the coworkers for switching to the low fat option. I also use red bell pepper instead of tomato. I always make these on cookie sheets, though I think the ones I use are bigger than the 9x13 suggested here. Basic, easy, yummy receipe for your next office party or baby shower.
a family must on every occasion

My whole family loves this (even the kiddos)! I used just 1 fat free cream cheese-its only 30 calories per serving, obviously none from fat, tastes the same to me. No one even noticed. Also, I used 1/4 c. mayo (made with olive oil for half the calories) and 1/4 c. greek yogurt. We always use greek yogurt in place of sour cream. Love it! Zero fat, lots of protein, no guilt. Then just half the pkg. of ranch, spreads on a little thinner, but who needs that much gunk? If you need more spread, just dont half the recipe, but you can still use all the healthier ingredients! Yum!

Love love! Been making for years! I use a large cookie sheet (jelly roll pan) and it makes well over 12 servings. The only veggies I use are broccoli, cauliflower, and shredded carrots. EVERYONE raves about these!

Here's a tip to get your veggies and cheese to stay put: Put a sheet of plastic wrap over the top and smoosh the veggies into the cream cheese mixture before putting in the fridge to set/chill.
LOVE LOVE LOVE! The perfect party appetizer! I roast the broccoli with a little garlic salt and olive oil first, but it is always a hit. Have I mentioned that I LOVE THIS?

Really good. Easy to make and makes a lot of servings. I substitute sour cream for the mayo since we hate mayo and add green onions. Don't bother with the tomatoes and use big and flaky cresents so the crust holds up with all those veggies

Hi Everyone! Try this..Instead old "plain cream cheese", use Philly chive and onion cream cheese, mixed with sour cream instead of mayo...add some garlic powder! Yum! All my friends "can't figure out why my veggie pizza has better flavor "than theirs!" You won't need ranch dip this way.I also use "fat free if a store carries it.Stay away from tomatoes, unless you "just use the outer tomatoe(no juices) I've used dill dip on top also, then put veggies over it! Be sure to add "green onions if you want to give it an "extra kick". Even if you "just use the greens".
Very good. Made exactly like the recipe. One thing I did not like is that the crust turns soft/soggy after a while - definitely over night. Would make again if it will be eaten right away.

One of our favorite appetizers! I love that you can add any veggies that you like...I always use broccoli, mushrooms, tomatoes, green peppers and black olives (along w/ the cheddar cheese), but the possibilities are endless! :)
this is yummy and nice to take as a dish to a get together.

I chop the veges together and mix it with the cream chesse. Then I top with the shredded cheese and tomatoes. I have also made it with the Fiesta RAnch dip and I think it adds a bit more flavor. I usually use pillsbury thin crust pizza dough - it holds its form a bit better. The other thing I do to save time is I buy the small bag of broccoli/caul/carrot mixture in the refrig section of the grocery store. It makes it easier to dump it all in my chopper and in 5 minutes my veges are ready. If I have bell pepper, I add it, but if I don't it still tastes great! Red onion added is also good - don't need a lot though.
We loved this recipe. The only thing I did differently was rolled out the crust a little because we like a thinner crust.

I got rave reviews from my guests at my bunco party! It was easy to put together. I used "big and buttery" crescent rolls instead of regular. I've made and eaten plenty of different veggie pizzas and I have to say I LOVE this recipe!!
very good
AMAZING RECIPE!!! My husband hates vegetable pizza and loves this recipe!!!
I was introduced to this pizza many years ago and it's been a favorite since. I like to do different veggies to change it up some.
No crescent rolls - use boboli pizza dough

I used to eat this all the time when I was a little girl. My aunt made it. I have been looking all over for a recipe to know exactly what to mix with the cream cheese, and this is the only place I could find it. Sooooo good!!!! Thanks for posting it!

I make a version that is a little different, no Mayo I use like 6 ounces sour cream and instead of the ranch use chopped fresh dill and garlic powder and I use cucumbers, carrots brocoli and tomatos. This also also FANTASTIC the next day

Instead of cutting this AFTER you have put the cream cheese mixture and veggies on it, cut it BEFORE you put anything on it. That way, if you serve it in the pan, it isn't messed up when you cut it. If you serve it in something else, it is still much easier to get out of the pan. I use a pizza cutter to cut the crust.

I decided to make this recipe for a baby shower for a different way to serve veggies and dip and I loved it!! I had to take a little taste to try it out before serving and it was so good that I couldn't stop sneaking pieces. The guests were lucky there were any left for them. I will definitely be making this again. I made it exactly per recipe (except I left out the peppers and tomatoes).
Great way to clean out your fridge by using whatever produce you have! I couldn't wait an hour to let it chill before cutting...I dug right in!

This recipe is so delicious, but I also changed things up a bit. I recommend cutting the vegetable pieces very small and using about a 1/2 cup of each vegetable. I used 2 packages of Crescent rolls but cut the mayo and Ranch seasoning roughly in half. I go by taste most of the time and add ingredients gradually. I used one 8 oz container of cream cheese with chive and onion and a few spoonfuls of sour cream. I liked the idea of layering the cheese first and also added a few thinly slice radishes and used heirloom tomatoes. These tomatoes are so good. Again, just sprinkled all of the vegetables over gradually in very thin layers to prevent one flavor dominating and to make eating less messy. This dish is really delicious and beautiful, especially with the colorful tomatoes.
